thread.title: Meyer calls latest effort 'not a real book'
thread.title_full: Meyer calls latest effort 'not a real book'

title: Meyer calls latest effort 'not a real book'
text:
Stephenie Meyer calls the supplement to her anniversary 'Twilight' edition not quite a 'real' book. (Photo: Charles Sykes, Charles Sykes/Invision/AP)
3 CONNECT 13 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Stephenie Meyer's latest gender-swapping Twilight effort made a ton of headlines.
But at Thursday at New York Comic Con, the author said the book, paired with an original version of of Twilight for the series' 10th anniversary, isn't exactly "real."
Life and Death: Twilight Reimagined , announced Tuesday, is essentially the same story, except Meyer switched the names and genders of the main characters, with Bella and Edward now Beau and Edythe.
"I want to say this is not a real book, and I am totally aware of this," Meyer said at the Jacob Javits Convention Center.
The book becomes the story of a female vampire and the human teenage boy she falls in love with.The new book jacket also features hands holding a green apple instead of its iconic red one.
USA TODAY
New 'Twilight' novel swaps Edward and Bella's genders
On Good Morning America earlier this week, Meyer said she "wanted to do something fun for the 10th anniversary," adding that Life and Death's gender-swap was a nod to readers who complained Bella seemed like a damsel in distress.
USA TODAY
Wait, what?! Fans react to gender-swapped 'Twilight'
Contributing: The Associated Press
